summary: This bill, H.R. 3234, amends the Federal Deposit Insurance Act concerning reciprocal deposits. It modifies the amounts of reciprocal deposits an insured depository institution can hold without being considered funds obtained through a deposit broker. The bill changes the percentages of total liabilities that qualify for exemption based on the institution's size. It also redefines the criteria for an "agent institution" based on its CAMELS rating.
